data.name: Enterprise Architecture Integration with CLI-Based Scaffolding

taskDescription.description: Integrate enterprise architecture templates with intelligent NestJS and Prisma CLI scaffolding to create a streamlined, enterprise-grade project generation workflow that eliminates legacy template support and focuses on CLI-based base scaffolding enhanced with domain-specific features.
taskDescription.businessRequirements: Transform PrismaCraft from a template-based generator to an intelligent CLI orchestrator that creates enterprise-grade NestJS projects with Prisma integration, comprehensive tooling, and domain-driven architecture. The solution must provide faster setup, better maintainability, and professional-grade output while reducing custom template maintenance overhead.
taskDescription.technicalRequirements: Implement CLI integration services for NestJS and Prisma, create enterprise enhancement services for applying security/monitoring/testing features, develop new MCP tools for scaffolding and domain enhancement, and establish a two-phase generation process (CLI scaffolding + enterprise enhancements).
acceptanceCriteria: CLI integration services implemented for NestJS and Prisma with command execution capabilities
Enterprise enhancement service created to apply security, monitoring, testing, and Docker configurations
Project generator tool updated to use scaffold service instead of legacy template approach
Two-phase generation workflow established: base CLI scaffolding followed by enterprise enhancements
Comprehensive integration plan documented with migration strategy and success metrics
All legacy template dependencies removed and replaced with CLI-based approach
Generated projects include enterprise features: authentication, caching, monitoring, security, testing, documentation
Domain-specific enhancement capabilities implemented for post-scaffolding customization
Error handling and validation implemented for CLI command execution
Performance optimized to complete project generation in under 20 seconds

patterns: NestJS modular architecture with MCP server integration
TypeScript strict mode with comprehensive ESLint configuration
Domain-driven design patterns in template structure

fileStructure.src/mcp/tools/: MCP tool implementations including project generator
fileStructure.src/mcp/services/: Core services for template processing and project generation

designPrinciples: Separation of concerns with modular architecture

issues.description: Heavy reliance on custom Handlebars templates requires constant maintenance as frameworks evolve
Template processing and file generation creates overhead compared to CLI-based scaffolding
Current template approach doesn't leverage official CLI tools and best practices
Large template codebase increases maintenance burden and reduces agility

technicalDebt: Custom template logic that duplicates CLI functionality
rootCauses: Over-reliance on custom templates instead of leveraging official CLI tools
Lack of separation between base scaffolding and enterprise enhancements
Monolithic template approach instead of modular enhancement strategy

existingPatterns: MCP tool pattern with Zod validation
NestJS service injection and dependency management
Template service pattern with Handlebars rendering
Comprehensive error handling with Winston logging
implementationContext.testingApproach: Jest-based unit and integration testing with comprehensive coverage

researchReports.title: Enterprise Architecture Integration Research Assessment
researchReports.summary: Comprehensive evaluation of research requirements for CLI-based enterprise scaffolding implementation
researchReports.findings:
STRATEGIC RESEARCH ASSESSMENT COMPLETED:

Evaluated task requirements against specific criteria for critical knowledge gaps:

✅ TECHNOLOGIES/FRAMEWORKS IDENTIFIED:
- NestJS CLI: Well-documented, stable API for project scaffolding
- Prisma CLI: Comprehensive command set for database operations
- Enterprise patterns: Standard implementations available
- Docker/CI-CD: Established patterns in existing codebase

✅ INTEGRATION PATTERNS DOCUMENTED:
- CLI command execution via child_process (Node.js standard)
- Service orchestration patterns already implemented
- Enterprise enhancement layering approach defined
- MCP tool integration patterns established

✅ SECURITY/COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS:
- Standard enterprise security patterns (JWT, RBAC, rate limiting)
- Docker security best practices well-documented
- CI/CD security scanning tools (standard implementations)
- No specialized compliance requirements identified

✅ PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION:
- CLI execution performance: Standard Node.js patterns
- File system operations: Established best practices
- Template processing: Moving away from Handlebars to CLI generation
- No performance bottlenecks requiring external research

✅ FRAMEWORK VERSIONS:
- NestJS: Current stable version, no breaking changes
- Prisma: Current stable version, well-documented migration paths
- Dependencies: Standard enterprise packages with stable APIs

DECISION: NO CRITICAL RESEARCH REQUIRED

All implementation approaches are well-understood from codebase analysis:
- CLI integration patterns are standard Node.js implementations
- Enterprise enhancement templates follow established patterns
- Service orchestration uses existing architectural patterns
- Technology stack is mature with comprehensive documentation

IMPLEMENTATION CONFIDENCE: HIGH
- Clear architectural direction established
- Technology choices validated against existing codebase
- Implementation patterns align with current system design
- Risk factors identified and mitigated through design decisions
researchReports.recommendations:
IMPLEMENTATION RECOMMENDATIONS:

1. PROCEED WITH CONFIDENCE:
- All technical approaches validated through codebase analysis
- Implementation patterns align with existing architecture
- No blocking technical unknowns identified

2. FOCUS AREAS FOR IMPLEMENTATION:
- CLI service integration (standard Node.js patterns)
- Enterprise template application (existing pattern extension)
- Service orchestration (established architectural approach)
- Quality validation (existing testing patterns)

3. RISK MITIGATION STRATEGIES:
- Incremental implementation with validation checkpoints
- Comprehensive testing at each integration layer
- Fallback mechanisms for CLI command failures
- Clear error handling and user feedback

4. OPTIMIZATION OPPORTUNITIES:
- Parallel CLI command execution where possible
- Caching of CLI operation results
- Progressive enhancement of generated projects
- Performance monitoring of scaffold operations

5. QUALITY ASSURANCE:
- Unit testing for all CLI integration services
- Integration testing for end-to-end scaffold workflows
- Performance benchmarking of generation processes
- User experience validation through preview modes
